result.execSummary:
The defendant Demario Marshall Easley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All Court costs, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 9783.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due an dowing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 14CF2707.  Credit for 71 days.

superMiscConds.notes: No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF2707, but consecutive to count three.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF2707; but consecutive to count two.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 71 days credit CONSECUTIVE to Case No. 14CF2707; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7 1/2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to Case No. 14CF2707 but CONSECUTIVE to Count 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 1/2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  11 1/2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to Case No. 14CF2707 but CONSECUTIVE to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 9 1/2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Attorney Joshua Davis Uller in court, defendant Demario Marshall Easley not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing hearing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

At the hour of 11:42 a.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson submitted the following verdicts:
Count 1:  "We, the jury, find the defendant, Demario Easley, GUILTY of the offense of Possession of a Firearm by a Felon in the manner and form as charged in count one of the information."
Count 2:   "We, the jury, find the defendant, Demario Easley, GUILTY of the offense of Possession of Controlled Substances - Marijuana (party to a crime) in the manner and form as charged in count two of the information."
Count 3:   "We, the jury, find the defendant, Demario Easley, GUILTY of the offense of Possession of Controlled Substances - Heroin in the manner and form as charged in count three of the information."
all verdicts:  "Dated as Milwaukee, Wisconsin, this 15th day of June, 2016."   signed by the foreperson.

Court polls the jury.  Jury released from services and out of the box.
State requests judicial notice of Case# 09CM03355 and 10CF03734.  State's motion for judgment on the verdicts.  Defense counsel motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdicts.
Court orders judgment of conviction on the verdicts.

Defendant is REMANDED pending sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in court with Attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in custody.  Daniel Gabler, appearing for Megan Marie Williamson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel motion to withdraw - defendant is serving a prison sentence and would now qualify for Public Defender representation.
Court holds indigency hearing with defendant.

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Statements by the Defendant.  Based upon review of the Defendant's statements made in court, the Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualify for representation.  Due to the age of the case and for purposes of judicial economy, Court will appoint counsel for defendant at the County's expense. 
The Court appoints Attorney Joshua Uller to represent defendant at the rate of $60 per hour;  Attorney Uller present in court and accepted the appointment. 

Determination regarding repayment of attorney fees to be on the next court date.

Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in court with attorney James T. Moczydlowski.  Defendant Demario Marshall Easley in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol. Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.
